body:
I'm aware that Rails encourages developers to use better and superior code practices and discourage bad code practices but certain JavaScript libraries use parameters for whatever odd reason they do.

I think it's more important to allow Rails developers to use those libraries without 1. modifying the Rails library 2. messing up their code or 3. modifying the library they're trying to use.

the asset pipeline for Rails is fantastic and it alleviates a lot of the path issues and centralizes assets. it'd be nice to use even in these corner cases to allow for code consistency and reliability.

I don't think it would have to increase code overhead by a lot. even this patch only adds 100 lines of code which I can't imagine is an overbearing waste.
